Detailed Description

Send a command to the robot and manage the movement action.

ROS Node Name
  • state_machine
Authors
Carmine Tommaso Recchiuto, Francesco Ganci (S4143910)
Version
v1.0

Description:

Despite of the name, this node is not a state machine: it receives a command, then calls the action providing a random target. After a destination is provided to the movement action, the node waits until the destination is reached.

The node allows also cancel the action: see the description of the service /user_interface.

In general the node, when enabled, works in this way. First of all, if a new target is obtained from the service /user_interface; then, the node sends the request to the movement action. After sent the request, the node executes a check upon the status of the movement action every at least 0.1 seconds (see WAITING_DELAY) for maximum 30 seconds (see MAX_WAITING_TIME). If the action requires too much time, the request is cancelled.

Note that the bounds of the target are provided once in the main function: x in [-5.0, 5.0], y in [-5.0, 5.0].

Communication with Jupyter is implemented through a dedicated topic of type JupyterTargetInfo.

Publishers:

  • /jupyter_mission_info : JupyterTargetInfo.msg
    Updates about the running mission for Jupyter.

Services:

  • /user_interface : Command.srv
    The service can enable or disable the node, and also cancel any request sent to the movement action. Send start to start the movement. Send any other strings to stop the working cycle and possibly cancel any active movement action.

Clients:

  • /position_server : RandomPosition.srv
    See position_service.cpp

Using actions

  • go_to_point : GoToPoint.action
    See the py node go_to_point.py

TODOs

Todo:

the command should be case-insensitive

review the output to the screen

Function Documentation

◆ jupyter_pub()

void jupyter_pub ( bool  working,
bool  failure,
bool  goal_cancelled,
float  x,
float  y,
float  th,
bool  success,
float  time 
)

general function for publishing a info msg to Jupyter

This function allows to make the update message and publish it to Jupyter quickly, just passing the fields of the message as parameters.

Parameters
workingif the random behaviour is active or not
failureif the mission failed or not
goal_cancelledif the goan has been cancelled or not
xthe 'x' target component
ythe 'y' target component
ththe head angle in the target
successif the mission succeeded or not
timehow much time the mission did last until now
Note
don't use this function directly, because here there's no way to ensure the coherence of the fields each other. Use the wrappers.

178

180  msg.failure = failure;
181  msg.goal_cancelled = goal_cancelled;
182  msg.x = 0;
183  msg.y = 0;
184  msg.th = 0;
185  msg.success = success;
186  msg.time = time;
187 
188  global_jupy->publish( msg );
189 }

◆ jupyter_target_unreached()

void jupyter_target_unreached ( )

failure of the mission (other reason)

the objective can't be reached due to some other reason. Typically, the node state_machine interrupts the mission when the maximum time expired.

void jupyter_update_mission ( rt2_assignment_2::GoToPointGoal &  goal,
float  time 
)

mission update (the robot is trying to reach the target)

while the robot is moving towards the goal nder the random behaviour, the node regularly sends a notification to the GUI to make it aware about how the mission is going on.

Parameters
goalthe objective
timehow much time elapsed from the beginning of the mission

int main ( int  argc,
char **  argv 
)

ROS node main - state_machine.

Definition at line 282 of file state_machine.cpp.

283 {
284 
285  ros::init(argc, argv, "state_machine");
286  ros::NodeHandle n;
287 
288  // provided services
289  ros::ServiceServer service = n.advertiseService("/user_interface", user_interface);
290 
291  // client
292  ros::ServiceClient client_rp = n.serviceClient<rt2_assignment_2::RandomPosition>("/position_server");
293 
294  // action
295  actionlib::SimpleActionClient<rt2_assignment_2::GoToPointAction> ac( "go_to_point", true );
296  acglobal = &ac; // share the access to the action
297  ac.waitForServer( );
298 
299  // infos for Jupyter interface
300  ros::Publisher jupy = n.advertise<rt2_assignment_2::JupyterTargetInfo>( "/jupyter_mission_info", 1000 );
301  global_jupy = &jupy;
302 
303  // bounds for the random target
304  rt2_assignment_2::RandomPosition rp;
305  rp.request.x_max = 5.0;
306  rp.request.x_min = -5.0;
307  rp.request.y_max = 5.0;
308  rp.request.y_min = -5.0;
309  rt2_assignment_2::Position p;
310 
311  // useful
312  rt2_assignment_2::GoToPointGoal empty_goal;
313 
314  // init the state of the GUI
315  jupyter_publish_status( false );
316 
317  while( ros::ok() )
318  {
319  ros::spinOnce();
320 
321  // execute this only if the node is enabled
322  if (start)
323  {
324  jupyter_publish_status( true );
325 
326  // ask for a random target
327  client_rp.call(rp);
328 
329  // prepare the request to the movement action
330  rt2_assignment_2::GoToPointGoal goal;
331  goal.x = rp.response.x;
332  goal.y = rp.response.y;
333  goal.theta = rp.response.theta;
334  std::cout << "NEXT TARGET (" << goal.x << ", " << goal.y << ", " << goal.theta << ")" << std::endl;
335 
336  // the target is requested to the movemet action: the robot starts to move
337  ac.sendGoal( goal );
338 
339  // waiting for the robot to reach the goal unless any preemption request
340  bool success = false;
341  float timeFromStart = 0.f;
342  std::string state = "ACTIVE";
343  while( state != "SUCCEEDED" )
344  {
345  // wait the minimum time
346  (ros::Duration(WAITING_DELAY)).sleep();
347 
348  // update the status of the node
349  ros::spinOnce();
350  timeFromStart += WAITING_DELAY;
351  state = ac.getState( ).toString( );
352 
353  // evaluate the new state
354  if( state == "PREEMPTED" )
355  {
356  std::cout << "The goal has been cancelled. " << std::endl;
357  jupyter_target_cancelled( );
358  break;
359  }
360  else if( timeFromStart > MAX_WAITING_TIME )
361  {
362  std::cout << "Unable to reach the final position within the deadline. " << std::endl;
363  jupyter_target_unreached( );
364  break;
365  }
366 
367  // send the status to Jupyter GUI
368  jupyter_update_mission( goal, timeFromStart );
369 
370  }
371  success = ( state == "SUCCEEDED" );
372 
373  if( success )
374  {
375  std::cout << "Position reached" << std::endl;
376  jupyter_target_reached( goal, timeFromStart );
377  }
378  else
379  {
380  std::cout << "Final goal not reached" << std::endl;
381  }
382  }
383  else
384  {
385  jupyter_publish_status( false );
386  }
387 
388 
389  }
390  return 0;
391 }

◆ user_interface()

bool user_interface ( rt2_assignment_2::Command::Request &  req,
rt2_assignment_2::Command::Response &  res 
)

implementation of service /user_interface

Parameters
reqThe command to execute. If the command is the string "start" then the node is enabled. Any other request will turn off the node.
ressuccess or not.
See also
Command.srv

Definition at line 123 of file state_machine.cpp.

124 {
125  if (req.command == "start")
126  {
127  start = true;
128  std::cout << "[state_machine] START command received. " << std::endl;
129  res.ok = true;
130  }
131  else
132  {
133  if ( start )
134  {
135  std::cout << "[state_machine] STOP command received, preempting the goal. " << std::endl;
136 
137  // cancel the running goal
138  acglobal->cancelAllGoals( );
139  res.ok = true;
140  }
141  else
142  {
143  std::cout << "[state_machine] state machine already stopped. " << std::endl;
144  res.ok = false;
145  }
146 
147  start = false;
148  }
149  return true;
150 }
